column2:
When signing up for a new account on Schoology, you may encounter a message that the email address domain you have entered is reserved. This message indicates that your school or organization has subscribed to Schoology, and that they are managing account creation from a system-level.

To create an account at this school, you must consult the System Administrator of the school. If you're not sure who might administer the school account, please submit a ticket to our Support Team for assistance locating the System Admin.
column4: The email address domain you have entered is reserved

column2:
Dealing with “Insecure Content” errors (the “Load Anyway/Load Content” option)

Schoology now utilizes SSL (HTTPS) on all pages throughout the site. This enables an extra layer of security, and a safe transmission of data from Schoology servers to your computer.

Since many users add custom embedded content from third-party sources (e.g. YouTube), it is possible for a user to embed content from a source that does not utilize SSL (HTTPS). While this practice is generally not harmful (assuming that you know the source you add content from is trusted), this does mean that most web browsers will now complain when trying to view “mixed content.”

For instance, if Chrome detects "insecure content" on your page, such as embedded videos using http instead of https, it will block the load of that content and present a Mixed-Content warning. Chrome will give you a message with an option to “Load Anyway,” as well as information to learn more.

If you are using Chrome version 20 or earlier, you will see a yellow message at the top of your browser that reads “This page has insecure content,” followed by options to “Load Anyway” or “Don’t Load (Recommended)."

If you are using Chrome version 21 or later, a gray shield icon will appear on the right side of your browser address bar.

 

How to Proceed when Getting a Warning

If you trust that the content is safe, you can select the option to “Load Anyway” in the yellow message, or click on the gray shield icon and then select “Load Anyway."

Once you have selected this option, you must then reload the page to get the content to load properly.

 

How to Prevent this Message from Appearing

When embedding content into Schoology, try to use sources that start with HTTPS, or use SSL. For instance, within YouTube, you have an option to “Use HTTPS” when choosing to embed (see below). While this option will vary from website to website, most websites today have a similar option.
column4: What do I do with an "Insecure Content" error message?

column2:
What does this message mean?

This error message, "The email address you have entered is already registered," indicates that there exists in Schoology an account associated with your email address. This email address may have been used in an account at your school, or it may have been used when creating a free teacher account during sign up.

 

What should I do?

To use this same email address to create a new account, you may login to your account associated with this email, and delete your previous account. Alternatively, you use a different email address to create a new account, or you may log into your previous account and adjust the email address saved to the previous account.

 

I can't login to my previous account

If you experience difficulty logging into your previous account, you may reset your password by clicking on the Forget your login information? link, and login to the account associated with your email address. Please note that you must have an email address associated with your Schoology account in order to reset your password. If you have additional questions, you can submit a ticket to reach our Support Team.
column4: The email address you have entered is already registered

column2:
What does this message mean?

This message appears when trying to merge an administered account (Enterprise) into another account. Since the System Admin (Enterprise) of the school manages your account, you must work with the System Admin to move content from the administered account into your new account.

 

What should I do?

If your goal is for the free, individual account to be your primary account, please follow these steps:

  1. Login to the administered account.
  2. Save your courses to Resources.
  3. Share your resources from the administered account to the new account.
  4. Then, work with the System Admin of the administered school to delete your previous account.

If your goal is for the administered account to be your primary account, please follow these steps:

  1. Login to the administered account with the username or email address and password given to you by the System Admin.
  2. Navigate to Account Settings, located in the downfacing arrow on the upper right corner of Schoology.
  3. Click on the option to Merge Accounts.
  4. Enter the login credentials of your free, individual account.
  5. Click Validate Account to complete.

Note: Merging an account will delete the merged account, but the you'll will retain access to your created content. After the merge, you can login using the login credentials listed in your school account.

 

Who is my System Admin?

If you're not sure how to locate the System Admin of your administered school, please see this article for more information.

 

I can't login to my previous account

If you experience difficulty logging into your previous account, you may reset your password by clicking on the Forget your login information? link, and login to the account associated with your email address. Please note that you must have an email address associated with your Schoology account in order to reset your password. If you have additional questions, you can submit a ticket to reach our Support Team.
column4: Sorry, you are not allowed to merge subscribed accounts into this account

column2:
What does this message mean?

This message appears when trying to delete an Instructor account that is still enrolled as a Course Admin (Instructor) of a course. Schoology courses require a course admin in order for a faculty role to monitor course activity at all times.

 

What should I do?

To delete your account, we recommend that you first delete your course sections. Deleting a course section will remove course content, student enrollment, and student content from the school. If you'd like to save your course content before deleting the course, you can save your course to resources and share it with another Schoology account.
column4: We cannot delete your account since you are still enrolled in the following courses

column2:
Where did the course go?

If a course no longer appears in the Courses dropdown in the top menu of your Schoology account, there may be two possibilities regarding the course's whereabouts.

  • The course is in the Archived area of your My Courses.
  • The course has been deleted.

 

What are Archived courses?

Course sections are associated with grading periods in Schoology. Seven days prior to the end of a grading period, you'll begin to see a message at the top of your Schoology account with a warning at the grading period will end. In the course profile, you'll also see a message at the top of the course with details regarding the approaching end-date.

 

How do I find Archived courses?

To find archived and upcoming courses, navigate to your My Courses area by following these steps:

  1. Click on the Courses area on the top menu.
  2. Select the option to See All.
  3. By default, you'll see a list of all of your current courses. To view past courses, click on the Archived tab.

How do I "reactivate" a course?

If you'd like to keep the same course material and roster of students for a longer period of time, you can extend the life of the course by adding a grading period. If your course is not associated with any grading periods, you do not have to add grading periods to extend the course into a new school year.

To add a new grading period to a course, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the Course Profile of your previous course.
  2. Select Gradebook in the left menu of the Course Profile.
  3. Select Grade Setup directly underneath Gradebook.
  4. Click on the Edit button to the right of Grading Periods & Final Weights.
  5. Enter a name for the new grading period.
  6. Select a start-date and end-date.
  7. Click Save to complete.

Note: Depending on the settings in place at your school or organization, this feature may not be available to you. The System Administrator at your school or organization can create and add grading periods to the course for you.


My course as been deleted

If you or a colleague had deleted the course, you can locate the course in the Course Recycle Bin. Depending on the settings in place at your school, you may be able to delete additional courses.

To view a list of the deleted courses, follow these steps from the account that had deleted the course:

  1. Click on the Courses area on the top menu.
  2. Select the option to See All.
  3. If a course has been deleted, you'll see a Deleted Courses link in gray on the top right of the page.
  4. Click on the Deleted Courses link.

The information listed in the Deleted Courses area displays the course and section name, as well as the date and time of its deletion.

Restore a course

To restore a deleted course section, follow these steps:

  1. Click on the check box to the left of the course name.
  2. To select all courses, click on the check box to the left of the Courses column title.
  3. Click on the Restore button.
  4. If you're sure you'd like to restore the course, click on the button to Restore.

If you're not able to locate the missing course using these steps, you can submit a ticket to reach our Support Team.
column4: Help! My courses are missing!

column2:
Issue

If you have the PowerSchool app installed to your course, and a graded item hasn't synced with PowerSchool, you may encounter an error message: You have multiple grading categories in PowerSchool that share the same name. Please navigate to our help center article to resolve the issue with Pearson

This issue occurs when there are two grading categories in PowerSchool that share the same name when there should only be one grading category. That is, there had been an issue on PowerSchool's end that had allowed the creation of two grading categories with the same name.

 

Solution

There are two paths, but either way, we recommend contacting PowerSchool about this issue so that it does not happen again.

  • Contact PowerSchool and ask them to fix this issue for you. The issue is that somehow, there are two categories in the database for categories while only one shows up in the PowerSchool Gradebook. This is an issue because the API tries to create an assignment with the same category name and returns an error from the Oracle database that says "Error - Got more than one result - resultSize=2."
  • You can work with your PowerSchool admin to modify the category title and abbreviation in the database so that you do not have duplicates (you can also delete the duplicate, but we do not recommend deleting anything, since it's an irreversible action). The procedure to modify the duplicate category is listed below:
    1. First, go into the PowerTeacher Gradebook for each of the affected sections.
    2. Once in the section, find the duplicate category and change both the name and the abbreviation to something that will stand out (e.g., append "Active").
    3. Once you have appended, or added, something that will make the difference obvious, go into DDA (Direct Database Access) and find the category that is not the one you had altered (since the one you had altered is the active grading category in the Gradebook). Once you've found the duplicate (and unused) category (e.g., the one that does not have "Active"), go ahead and modify that record to change both the Name and Abbreviation to something unique (e.g., append "Unused").

When you've reached a resolution, the graded items and grades should synchronize.
column4: PowerSchool Assignment displays a Not Synced error message (Enterprise)

column2:
Issue

Mozilla released an update in Firefox version 23+ that blocks mixed content from appearing on the browser.
Google Chrome has also released a mixed content blocker in version 30+.

 

Solution

  • If you're using Firefox version 23+, you can resolve the issue by clicking on the shield to the left of the URL in the address bar. Please find more information about this release on Mozilla's blog post: https://blog.mozilla.org/tanvi/2013/04/10/mixed-content-blocking-enabled-in-firefox-23/.
  • To view mixed content in Chrome, click on the shield icon on the right side of the address bar and select the option to Load Anyway.
  • To circumvent the issue, try using secured domains (https://) for embedded content and packages. In many cases, adding an "s" to the "http://" URLs in the embed code also resolves the issue.

In Chrome

 

In Firefox
column4: I can't view videos and embedded content

column2:
This error message appears during the Sign Up process when the instructor of the course hasn't yet verified their Schoology account. If you see this message during Sign Up, please contact the instructor of the course to let them know that you're awaiting their verification.

In case you have difficulty reaching the instructor of the course, an email will be sent to the instructor automatically, notifying the instructor of your attempt to register for Schoology.

If you have any additional questions about the registration process, or if you haven't heard back from the instructor about the status of the course, please submit a request to the Schoology Help Desk for further assistance.
column4: We are unable to create an account for you

column2:
Why does this message appear?


If you encounter a message that reads Private Information, the information in the area you're trying to access may not be available for your Schoology account. This Private Information message might appear in the following profiles:
  • User profiles
  • Course profiles
  • Group profiles
  • School profiles
The settings that determine the kind of information available to other users are set in the User, Course, Group, and School Privacy Settings areas, respectively.

For example, in the image below, the user has set the privacy setting for her user profile to "Schoology Users." This privacy setting indicates that any Schoology user can click on her name and view her profile.

However, the user has set the remainder of the privacy setting to "School." Thus, if a Schoology user in her school clicks on her user profile, he'll see her profile without any issue. If a Schoology user outside of her school clicks on her user profile, he'll see a Private Information message in place of the profile content.




Where can I change Privacy Settings for my user account?


To change adjust the Privacy Settings for your personal user account, click on the downfacing arrow at the top right of Schoology and select Privacy area.

Where can I change the Privacy Settings for my courses and groups?


To adjust the Privacy Settings for your course or group, click on the Course or Group Options area on the left menu of the course/group profile. Select the option to Edit Privacy/Course Settings.

Where can I change Privacy Settings for my school (Enterprise)?


The ability to set privacy settings at the school level is only available to System Administrators (Enterprise). To adjust privacy settings at the school level, click on the System Settings Privacy Overrides area on the left menu of the Home page.


If you have an issue with a Private Information message that you'd like to report to Schoology, you can submit a ticket to reach our Support Team.
column4: Private Information Message

column2:
Why does this message appear?




If you encounter a message that reads Private Access Only, the area you'd like to view may not be currently accessible for your Schoology account. This Private Access Only message might appear in the following areas of Schoology:
  • User profiles
  • Courses
  • Groups
  • Tests/Quizzes
  • Schools
  • Parent View

How do I resolve the issue?

User profiles

If the issue occurs when trying to access someone's user profile, the user in question must adjust their privacy settings. Users can adjust their privacy setting from their Account Privacy Settings.



Courses and Groups

If the issue occurs when trying to access a course or group, make sure you're a member of the course or group, or speak with the instructor check the privacy settings at the course/group level.

Course and Group Admin can adjust Privacy Settings by clicking on the Course or Group Options area on the left menu of the course/group profile. The area to adjust settings is located in the Edit Privacy/Course Settings.



Depending on the settings in place at a school (Enterprise), users may also encounter a Private Access Only message when trying to access a course that has ended, or when trying to access a course from which they've been removed.



Tests/Quizzes

If students report that they see Private Access Only when trying to access their test/quiz, the test/quiz setting might be set to Hidden. To resolve the issue, the instructor of the course should make the test/quiz Available to a current time.


Schools

If the issue occurs when trying to access a school profile, make sure you're a member of the school or speak with an administrator at the school to check the privacy settings at the system level (Enterprise).

System Administrators can adjust Privacy Settings by clicking on the System Settings Privacy Overrides area on the left menu of the Home page.




Parent View

When parents encounter a Private Access Only message from their parent account, they may need to switch into their child's view of Schoology to access the page by following these steps:
  1. Click on the downfacing arrow on the top right of their Schoology account.
  2. Below their name, parents should see the name of the child(ren) associated with their account. To view the activity of a particular child, click on the child's name from the dropdown menu.
  3. Access the item (course, event, assignment, etc.) from within the Student Activity or Enrollments view.



If you have an issue with a Private Access Only message that you'd like to report to Schoology, you can submit a ticket to reach our Support Team.
column4: Private Access Only Message

column2:
If you're unable to click on the icon to attach a file, or if a student isn't able to submit an assignment in the Submissions area, you may need to update Flash on the browser from which you're working.

Download the latest version of Flash

To use the Advanced file uploader, Download the latest version of Flash.

Use the Basic Uploader

You can also try using the Basic Uploader. Schoology uses a Flash Uploader to allow multiple uploads at a time and to display upload progress. However, if you continuously get errors with the default uploader, you can opt to use the Basic Uploader, which uploads one file at a time for maximum compatibility across platforms and networks.

To try the Basic Uploader, follow these steps:

1)    Select the arrow in the upper right corner of the page.
2)    Click Account Settings in the dropdown menu.
3)    Scroll to the bottom of the page.
4)    To the right of File Uploader, choose Basic.
5)    Click Save Changes to complete.
column4: I can't attach files or upload files

column2:
If you don't receive any email notifications from Schoology, one of the following issues may be affecting your account.

Your email address might not be verified


To make sure your email address has been verified in Schoology, check your Account Settings settings.
  1. From the downfacing arrow at the top right of your Schoology account, click on Account Settings.
  2. If you see a message to Resend Verification Email to the right of your email address, your email has not yet been verified in Schoology. To verify your email address, check the box and click on the Save Changes button below the Timezone setting.
  3. From your email inbox, open the email to verify your email address.
  4. Click on the link in the email to verify the address. I you have difficulty clicking on the link, you can copy and paste the link into your browser address bar.
  5. Once you navigate to the link, your email address should be successfully verified!
Please note that this link may only be used once. If you try to use the link again, you'll encounter an error message and you may need to resend a verification email to verify your account.

If you don't see the verification email in your inbox, please check your Junk or Spam folders.

Your Notifications settings might be disabled

It's also possible that email notifications are disabled on your account. To check your email notification settings, check the Notifications area of your account.
  1. From the downfacing arrow at the top right of your Schoology account, click on Notifications.
  2. Select the button next to the notification you'd like to change.
  3. Choose On (receive from all sources), Off (no notifications), or Custom (pick and choose the sources).
  4. Click Save Changes at the bottom.

The email might be going to your Junk or Spam folder


Sometimes, Schoology email notifications are sent to the Junk or Spam folders in your email system. To rule out this issue, please check your Junk and Spam folders for emails from Schoology.

If you find Schoology emails in your Junk or Spam folders, you can mark our address as "not junk" or "safe" emails to prevent the email from going to Junk or Spam in the future.

The school's filtering system or your email system might be blocking emails from Schoology


In some cases, the school's filtering system might block Schoology emails. To investigate this issue, it's best to work with the technical team at your school.

If at some point, you had marked a Schoology email notification as spam or "unsafe," your email system might also block Schoology emails. In this case, you may need to contact the Schoology Help Desk for assistance with a resolution.
column4: I don't receive any email notifications from Schoology

column2:
If you encounter an unexpected error message in Schoology, we apologize for the inconvenience. Please submit a ticket to the Schoology Help Desk.

The following information is helpful in understanding what may have caused the issue:

  • A link to the page on which the error message appeared.
  • A link to the user's Schoology profile that experienced the issue (if it's not your own).
  • A description of the steps or clicks it takes to reproduce the error message.
  • A description of the type of action you'd been trying to accomplish when the error message occurred.
column4: An unexpected error has occurred

column2:
If students are reporting that upcoming assignments, tests/quizzes, discussions, or events are appearing at a different day or time than the one you'd set for the item, the student's account may be associated with a different timezone.

To check and adjust a student's timezone, the student must:

  1. Click on the downfacing arrow at the top right of their Schoology account.
  2. Click Account Settings.
  3. In the Timezone field, the student should make sure that the timezone matches their current location.

Once the student changes his or her timezone setting, the dates for upcoming items should display correctly. If you find that the issue not resolved, however, you can contact the Schoology Help Desk for additional assistance.
column4: Why do students see due dates at a different time?

column2:
Parents can create new Schoology accounts on www.schoology.com by following these steps:

  1. Click on the Sign Up button.
  2. Click on the Parent button.
  3. Enter their Parent Access Code.
  4. Fill out the form with their information.
  5. And Click Register to complete.

However, sometimes, the steps above create an "Invalid access code" error message. When this error message occurs, it's possible that the Parent Access Code provided by the teacher had been the course access code that's used by students to register an account or join a new course.

Parent access codes look like: xxx-xxx-xxx.

If you don't have an access code with three sets of numbers, the teacher of the course must give you the correct Parent Access Code to create a Schoology account.
column4: Why doesn't my access code work? I'm a parent.

column2:
Tests/quizzes can remain open for a maximum of 6 hours before the session expires. Students should exit the test/quiz and resume it at a later time if the test will take longer than 6 hours to complete.

If a test/quiz session is open for over 6 hours, students will see a message that states, "The test/quiz that you are attempting to resume has expired. In order to continue, you must exist the test/quiz and resume progress (please note: some quizzes are not resumable). Your previous work has been saved.

When students Close & Exit Test/Quiz, they'll be taken back to the Test/Quiz tab in order to Resume the test.

Note: Test/quizzes must be set to Resumable in order for students to resume it.
column4: Expired Test/Quiz

column2:
Students may see an error message, "You are attempting to submit an answer for an assessment that is already completed," in the following situation:

  1. The student has opened a singular attempt of a test/quiz in multiple locations. These locations can include multiple browsers and multiple devices.
  2. In one of the open test/quiz locations, the student submits the test/quiz.
  3. In another test/quiz location, the student attempts to submit the same attempt of the test/quiz again.

When students try to submit the same attempt a second time, they'll encounter the error message above. Since the attempt has already been submitted, the student must start a new attempt if he or she would like to make another submission.
column4: You are attempting to submit an answer for an assessment that is already completed

column2: Currently, accounts outside of the U.S. and Canada  must be manually verified by a Schoology representative. If you have a mobile number outside of the U.S. and Canada, you can  submit a ticket to reach our Support Team by clicking on the link near the top of this page. Please provide a link to your Schoology profile to help the team verify your account as quickly as possible!
column4: I didn't receive a code to verify my account

column2:
Sign Up

If you don’t already have an account on Schoology, download the Schoology app from the Apple App Store. Touch the app icon to open it on your device and follow these steps: 

  1. Touch "Sign up for Schoology."
  2. Touch the Instructor button.
  3. Fill out your First Name, Last Name, Email Address, Password and Confirm Password.
  4. Select your Country and State. Enter your school name or school zip code in the School field and touch the Search icon (magnifying glass). Select your school from among the results. If your school does not appear, touch Request to Add Your School. You can always skip this step and return to it later if you wish.

Note: Schools under a System Administrator may or may not allow a user to register on their own. Schools under a System Administrator may also require a Faculty Access Code during the registration process. If you don’t know your faculty access code, tap on “Don’t have a code?” for more information.

Additional Note: Signing up is dependent on how the district decides to add users to the system. The district administrators may decide to mass import users and provide login information separately.

 

Login

You can use an email address or username to login to the application, depending on how your account was set up. The default view upon opening the app displays the Email and Username Login. 

Email Login

Click Email Login then enter your Email Address and Password. Then, hit Login. 

Username Login

Click Username Login. Enter the name of your school, which should automatically populate in a dropdown as you begin typing. The name, ID number, city, state, and zip code for the school should appear below. Select the school under which you are registered. Then, hit Login.

Note: Single Sign-On users will be navigated to their school page after they choose their school on the application. They can login with their SSO credentials on their school page. This same process applies to schools with Google Sign-On.

 

Quick Post

The Schoology iOS app Quick Post allows you to quickly create an updates, assignments, events and discussions from your Schoology homescreen as from within courses and groups. Clicking the Quick Post button in the top right corner of the screen to see these options: 

Post

  1. Tap on the + Icon on the upper right corner of the screen.
  2. Select Post.
  3. Select a course, group or personal update.
  4. You may update as many areas as you want by checking these areas on the New Post table.
  5. Add attachments from Library, Take Photo or Video, and Resources if you wish.
  6. Once you've chosen the area(s) to which you'd like to update and added optional attachments, enter your message. 
  7. Press Post. 

Add Assignment

To add an assignment, follow these instructions:

  1. Tap on the + icon on the upper right corner of the screen.
  2. Select Add Assignment.
  3. Select a course.
  4. Add attachments from Library, Take Photo or Video, and Resources if you wish.
  5. Add a Title, Category, Period, Due Date and Max points.
  6. Enter the assignment description.
  7. Press Create. 

Add Event

To create a course, group or personal event:

  1. Tap on the + Icon on the upper right corner of the screen.
  2. Select a course, group or personal event.
  3. You may update as many areas as you want by checking these areas on the New Post table.
  4. Add attachments from Library, Take Photo or Video, and Resources if you wish.
  5. Add a title to the event.
  6. Select a Start Date and Start Time.
  7. Select an optional End Time, or make the event an All Day Event.
  8. Add an optional description to the event.
  9. Press Create. 

Add Discussion

To add a discussion, follow these instructions:

  1. Tap on the + icon on the upper right corner of the screen.
  2. Select Add Discussion.
  3. Select a course or group discussion.
  4. You may update as many areas as you want by checking these areas on the New Discussion table.
  5. Add attachments from Library, Take Photo or Video, and Resources if you wish.
  6. Enter the discussion text.
  7. Press Create. 

Note: If you’d like to cancel your post or reply, you may tap the cancel icon on your device. 

 

 

Navigation Menu

The Schoology iPhone app navigation menu allows you to quickly navigate to each essential location on the Schoology App. Clicking the navigation menu in the top left corner of the screen gives you immediate access to:

  • Messages
  • Requests
  • Notifications
  • Recent Activity
  • Courses
  • Groups
  • Grades
  • Calendar
  • People
  • Account Settings
  • Resources
  • Logout 

This navigation menu is available on every page so that you can quickly navigate through the app from any point. 

 

Messages

Messages contain all of received and sent mail in your Schoology account. You can access messages by tapping the Messages icon from your navigation menu. You can refresh, compose a new message, and reply to existing messages directly from this sub-menu, or tap View All to see all messages. If you see a red number next to the Message icon in the navigation menu that means you have a new message from other Schoology members! 

Inbox

The inbox displays the received messages by default. A blue dot indicates an unopened message. To view the message, simply touch the message you would like to open. 

Sent

To view sent messages, press Sent from the Inbox screen, and touch the message you would like to open. 

Compose and Reply to Messages

To compose a message, tap on the pencil icon on the upper right corner of the screen while in the Inbox or Sent screen.

  1. Begin typing a name in the To field. The field will auto-populate with users to whom you may send mail. To select a user, simply tap on their name from among the list.
  2. Type the subject of the message.
  3. Type the content of the message.
  4. Tap the Send button on the upper right corner of the screen to complete.

To reply to a message, open the message and tap on the pencil icon on the upper right corner of the screen.

Note: Your school may or may not allow you to send messages to everyone in the school directory.

 

Requests

The Requests area lists all of the course, group and member requests that are associated with your Schoology profile. Click ‘Accept’ or ‘Deny’ depending on the action you would like to take for each item. If you see a red number next to the Requests icon in the navigation menu that means you have pending request from other Schoology members!

 

 

Notifications

Schoology sends you e-mail notifications for Social, Academic, Group, and School activity that occurs in your account. If you see a red number next to the Notifications icon in the navigation menu that means you have a new notification! 

 

Push Notifications

Users can choose to receive a push notification on their iOS device whenever an important piece of content is added to a course or group. Here are some examples of the types of occurrences our push notifications would relay:

  • course update post
  • group comments on updates and discussions
  • new assignment or discussion post
  • receive a private message

When a notification arrives, if the app is closed, then you may see a banner or alert display on your screen. If the Schoology app is open, then the notification will be displayed on screen. Touching the notification will take you to that piece of content within the Schoology iOS app. 

Enabling Notifications

To enable notifications, make sure you've downloaded the latest version of the Schoology iOS app from the Apple AppStore. After installing the update and logging into the app, you will be prompted to enable notifications.

Select OK, and you will be registered for notifications. 

Disabling Notifications

To disable notifications:

  1. Go to your iOS Settings.
  2. Select the Notifications option and then select the Schoology app.
  3. From there, select None for the Alert Style.
  4. You should stop receiving notifications immediately. 

Re-Enabling Notifications

To re-enable notifications:

  1. Go to your iOS Settings.
  2. Select the Notifications option and then select the Schoology app.
  3. From there, select either Banners or Alerts for the Alert Style.
  4. As a final step, you will need to 'kill' the Schoology app from the background if it is there. And then restart the app.

You will now start receiving notifications. 

Managing Which Notifications You Receive

To change the notifications that you receive:

  1. Log into the Schoology app.
  2. Select the Account Settings.
  3. From there, select the Notifications tab.
  4. You can customize the notifications you receive by adjusting the various settings under the Mobile column.
  5. Be sure to click the Save Changes button at the bottom of the panel.

   

Recent Activity

The Recent Activity area is displayed by default as the first screen you view when opening the Schoology iOS app. The Recent Activity area displays all of the most recent updates and blog posts that populate your Schoology Home page. To view additional posts, simply swipe upwards to scroll. 

Refresh Feed

At any point you may update the Recent Activity feed by swiping down on the Recent Activity screen then releasing to refresh. 

Create a New Post

You can create course, group, and personal updates from the iPhone application. To create a new post, follow these instructions:

  1. Tap on the + Icon on the upper right corner of the screen.
  2. Select Post.
  3. Select a course, group or personal update.
  4. You may update as many areas as you want by checking these area’s on the New Post table.
  5. Add attachments from Library, Take Photo or Video, and Resources if you wish.
  6. Once you have chosen the area(s) that you would like to update enter your update.
  7. Press Post. 

Comment on a Post

To add a comment on an update:

  1. Tap on the Comment button at the bottom of the post.
  2. Type your comment.
  3. Click Create. 

View and Add to Replies

To view existing replies to a post:

  1. Tap on the Comments button (speech bubble) below the post.
  2. If you’d like to add a reply, tap on the + icon on the upper right corner of the screen.
  3. Type your comment.
  4. Click Create. 

Note: If you’d like to cancel your post or reply, you may tap the Cancel button. Please remember to refresh the screen to see the latest information. 

 

Upcoming

The Upcoming area displays events, tests/quizzes, assignments, and discussions whose due date has not yet passed. This area can be accessed from by tapping the Upcoming button located at the bottom right of the Recent Activity Screen.

 

Courses

Courses list all of the courses for which you are an administrator or a member. To access a course section, tap on the name of your choice. The following information is available under a particular course section:

  1. Materials (Assignments, Tests/Quizzes, Files/Links, Discussions, Albums, Pages)
  2. Updates
  3. Upcoming
  4. Gradebook
  5. Attendance
  6. Members 

Materials

The Materials area lists all of the Assignments, Online Tests/Quizzes, Files/Links, and Discussions and Pages in a particular course. To view any of the materials options just click on their name. 

Course Updates

Course updates show the Recent Activity for a particular course section. For more information about Updates, please see Recent Activity. 

Course Upcoming

View upcoming items for a particular course. 

Gradebook

The Gradebook displays the Midterm/Final grades and Grading Periods grades by grading category. 

View Grades

You can view graded items by clicking on the Grading Period they are located in. 

Add or Edit Grades

You can view graded items by tapping on the title of the test/quiz, assignment or discussion. To add or edit grades:

  1. Tap on the row of the graded item.
  2. A list of course members will appear. Tap on a member's name to add or edit the grade.
  3. You can use the sliding bar to enter a point value,or tap on the field to manually enter a grade through the keypad.
  4. You can add an optional comment by entering it into the comment field found below the grade sliding bar.
  5. Select the checkbox to display the comment to the student, or uncheck the checkbox to keep the comment only visible to you.
  6. Repeat these steps for each student in the course. Tap Save to complete.

Note: Grades will not appear for grading periods that have not yet started. Graded items without a grading period will populate under the appropriate grading category under No Grading Period. 

Attendance

Access the Attendance feature by clicking ‘More’ in the bottom tab bar of the course profile. You can mark students as present, absent, late, or excused. By default, students are marked present to reduce the amount of clicking required during the attendance process.

 

Members

Access the Members feature by clicking ‘More’ in the bottom tab bar of the course profile. The Members area allows you to view all of the members of the course in alphabetical order by last name. To view a member profile, simply tap on the user’s name. Note: Depending on the settings in place at your school, you may or may not have access to view the member profiles.

 

Groups

The Groups area lists all of the groups for which you are an administrator or a member.

To access a group, tap on the name of your choice.

The following information is available under a particular group:

  • Updates
  • Discussions
  • Albums
  • Members
  • Resources 

Group Updates

Group updates show the Recent Activity for a particular group. For more information about Updates, please see Recent Activity. 

Group Discussions

Group Materials displays the discussions associated with the group. 

Group Albums

Group albums displays the media albums associated with the group. 

Group Members

The Members area allows you to view all of the members of the group in alphabetical order by last name. To view a member profile, simply tap on the user’s name. 

Group Resources

Access the Group Resources feature by clicking ‘More’ in the bottom tab bar of the course profile. Group Resources displays the materials and resources associated with the group.

 

Grades

The Grades area lists all of the courses for which you are an administrator or a member. The following information is available under a particular course section:

  • Midterm/Final grades
  • Test/Quiz, Assignment and Graded Discussion grades organized by grading period and grading category
  • Test/Quiz, Assignment and Graded Discussion grades with no grading period

To access the grades for a course section, tap on the section of your choice. After you click on the course section, choose Final Grades or the grading period you would like to view. 

Add or Edit Grades

You can view graded items by tapping on the title of the test/quiz, assignment, or discussion. To add or edit grades:

  1. Tap on the row of the graded item.
  2. A list of the course members will appear. Tap on a member's name to add or edit the grade.
  3. You can use the sliding bar to enter a point value, or tap on the field to manually enter a grade through the keypad.
  4. You can add an optional comment by entering it into the comment field found below the grade sliding bar. Select the checkbox to display the comment to the student, or uncheck the checkbox to keep the comment only visible to you.
  5. Repeat these steps for each student in the course.
  6. Tap Save to complete.

Note: Grades will not appear for grading periods that have not yet started. Graded items without a grading period will populate under the appropriate grading category under No Grading Period.

 

 

Calendar

Tap the navigation menu dropdown to access your Calendar. The Calendar area displays all of the events, tests/quizzes, assignments, and discussions that are associated with your Schoology profile in a day to day Upcoming events list as well as a traditional month-by-month Calendar view. 

Create an Event

You can create an event through the iOS application from your Schoology Calendar. To create an event:

  1. Tap on the + icon on the upper right corner of the screen.
  2. Select a course, group or personal event
  3. Add a title to the event.
  4. Select a Start Date and Start Time.
  5. Select an optional End Time, or make the event an All Day Event.
  6. Add an optional description to the event.
  7. Click Create

 

 

People

The People area allows you to view your School Directory and Network. Click on Directory to see a list of all the members in your School in alphabetical order by last name. To view a member profile, simply tap on the user’s name. Click Network to view of all the members of your Network in alphabetical order by last name.

Note: Depending on the settings in place at your school, you may or may not have access to view the school directory.

 

Account Settings

The Account Settings area allows you to control your account settings and preferences pertaining to Notifications, Account Settings and Privacy Settings. 

Notifications

Schoology sends you e-mail notifications for Social, Academic, Group, and School activity that occurs in your account. For more information about notifications on the iOS Schoology app, please see Notifications. 

Account Settings

The Account Settings tab allows you to change and update your personal information as well as Merge Accounts. 

Privacy Settings

The Privacy Settings tab allows you to select who can access and search for your information. 

 

 

Resources

Tapping Resources on the navigation menu allows you to access your existing Resources and Collections. For more information, please see Resource Center.

 

Logout

The Logout button is located on the dropdown navigation menu. You may logout at any time by tapping on the navigation icon on the upper left corner of the screen. Logout is the last option on the navigation menu.

Note: You will stay logged-in until the application until you manually logout or uninstall the application.
column4: iOS Mobile App (Instructors)

column2:
Sign Up

If you don’t already have an account on Schoology, download the Schoology app from Google Play. Tap on the app to open it on your device, and touch the Sign up Free link. This link will open up www.schoology.com/register on a browser for easy registration from our website.

Then follow these instructions:

  1. Touch the Instructor button.
  2. Fill out your First Name, Last Name, Email Address or Username, Password and Confirm Password.
  3. Enter your Country, State, and school name or school zip code into the School or Zipcode field. Then, hit Search. Select your school from among the results. If your school does not appear, tap on 'Request to Add your school' to create a new school.

Note: Schools under a System Administrator may or may not allow a user to register on their own.  If you are unable to register on your own, please contact your System Administrator for login information.  Schools under a System Administrator may also require a Faculty Access Code during the registration process.  Click on 'Don't have a code?' if you don't know your faculty access code. 

 

Login

If you don’t already have an account on Schoology, download the Schoology app from Google Play. You can use an email address or username to login on the application, depending on how your account was set up. See below for instructions:

Email Login

  1. Click Email Login.
  2. Enter your Email Address (e.g. johndoe@schoology.com) and Password.
  3. When complete, tap Login.

Username Login

  1. Click Username Login.
  2. Start typing the name of your school.  The name, ID number, city, state, and zip code for the school should appear below..  Tap on the name of the school to choose it.
  3. Enter your Username (e.g. johndoe) and Password.
  4. When complete, tap Login.

Note: Single Sign-On users will be forwarded to their school page after they choose their school on the application, and they will login with their SSO credentials. This same process applies to schools with Google Sign-On. SSO and Google SSO users should expect to see similar behavior as seen when logging in through their website.

 

Recent Activity 

The Recent Activity area displays all of the most recent updates and blog posts that populate your Schoology Home page. To view additional posts, simply scroll up or down.

Create a New Post

You can create course, group, and personal updates from the Android application. To create a new post:

  1. Tap on the Create (+) button on the upper right corner of the screen.
  2. Select 'Update'
  3. Click 'Post to' and select where you would like to post the update
  4. Type your update.
  5. Optional: To attach an item to your update, click on the buttons below : Photo/Video/File
  6. Tap the Post (>) button on the upper right corner to complete.

Create a New Comment

To reply to updates on the app:

  1. Tap on the 'Comment' button to the left of the post.
  2. Enter your comment.
  3. Tap the Post (>) button on the upper right corner to complete

Create an Assignment or Discussion

  1. Tap on the Create (+) button on the upper right corner of the screen.
  2. Select 'Assignment' / 'Discussion'
  3. Click 'Post to' and select where you would like to post the update
  4. Type the Title and Description and add the Due Date
  5. Optional: To attach an item to your update, click on the buttons below : Photo/Video/File
  6. Tap the Post (>) button on the upper right corner to complete.

Create an Event

  1. Tap on the Create (+) button on the upper right corner of the screen.
  2. Select 'Event'
  3. Click 'Post to' and select where you would like to post the update
  4. Enter the Date (When/End Date) , Title , Description and Who can RSVP
  5. Optional: To attach an item to your update, click on the buttons below : Photo/Video/File
  6. Tap the Post (>) button on the upper right corner to complete.

View and Add to Replies

To view existing replies to a post:

  1. Tap on the Text bubble button below the post to see the Comments
  2. Tap on the Create (+) button on the upper right corner of the screen
  3. Enter your comment.
  4. Tap the Post button on the upper right corner to complete.

Note: If you’d like to cancel your post or reply, you may tap the trash icon to go back, or hit the back button on your device. Please remember to refresh the screen to see the latest information, and tap the Home icon to return to the main menu.

You may view file attachments to Updates when the format is compatible with the device. Tapping on the file will download the file onto your device, where you can open the file to view it. You can also view the status of the download in the notification bar of the device. Tapping on a link attachment will open up a browser with the listed URL.

Delete a Post

To delete your post, touch and hold on the post you would like to delete. A popup will appear to either confirm or cancel the deletion. Please notethat you may only delete a post you’ve created.

 

Upcoming

The Upcoming area displays events, tests/quizzes, assignments, and discussions whose due date has not yet passed.

Events

Users may view the event listed in the Upcoming area.

Tests/Quizzes

Users may view the event listed in the Upcoming area.

Assignments

Users may open the assignment and add posts/replies.

Discussions

Users may open the discussion and add posts/replies.

Note: If you’d like to cancel your post or reply, you may tap the trash icon to go back, or hit the back button on your device. Please remember to refresh the screen to see the latest information, and tap the Home icon to return to the main menu.

 

Push Notifications

Users can choose to receive a push notification on their Android device whenever an important piece of content is added to a course or group.

Here are some examples of the types of occurrences that would generate a push notification:

  • course update post
  • group comments on updates and discussions
  • new assignment or discussion post
  • receive a private message

When a notification is sent to your device, you will see an alert display on your screen (as in the image below):

Touching the notification will take you to that piece of content within the Schoology Android app.

Disabling and Re-Enabling Notifications

To enable notifications, make sure you've downloaded v2.0 of the Schoology Android app from the Google Play Store. After installing the update and logging into the app, notifications will be automatically enabled for you on that device. 

To disable notifications:

  1. Select the Settings option in the Schoology app. 
  2. Deselect the Notifications option.

You should stop receiving notifications immediately.

To re-enable notifications:

  1. Select the Settings option in the Schoology app. 
  2. Select the Notifications option.

 You will now start receiving notifications. 

Customizing Notification Style

You can optionally choose to have your device vibrate, play a sound and/or flash its LED indicator when a notification is received. 

To adjust these settings:

  1. Select the Settings option in the Schoology app. 
  2. Select Vibrate, and/or Play a Sound, and/or Flash LED indicator.

Managing Which Notifications You Receive

To change the notifications that you receive:

  1. Select the Settings option in the Schoology app. 
  2. From there, select the Account Info under Account Settings.
  3. You can customize the notifications you receive by adjusting the various settings under the Notifcations tab.
  4. Be sure to click the Save Changes button at the bottom of the panel.

 

Courses

The Courses area lists all of the courses for which you are an administrator or a member. To access a course section, tap on the name of your choice. You may view the following course items by swiping the screen horizontally:

  • Assignments
  • Online Tests/Quizzes
  • Files/Links
  • Discussions
  • Albums
  • Pages

Course Updates

Course updates show the Recent Activity for a particular course section. For more information about Updates, please see Recent Activity.

Course Upcoming

To view Upcoming events, tests/quizzes, assignments, and discussions for a particular course, swipe to the right to access the course Upcoming area. For more information, please see Upcoming.

Assignments

The Assignments area lists all of the tests/quizzes and assignments in a particular course. To view course assignments, swipe to the left until you reach the Assignments screen. You can tap on an assignment to view details and comments, or tap on a test/quiz to view the test/quiz profile.

Create an Assignment

You can create an assignment by clicking on the Create button on the upper right corner of the screen.

Tests/Quizzes

The Tests/Quizzes area lists all of the tests/quizzes in a particular course. To view course tests/quizzes, swipe to the left until you reach the Tests/Quizzes screen. You can tap on a test/quiz to view test/quiz results directly from the device. You can grade tests/quizzes from the Results page as you would grade them from the web.

 

Discussions

The Discussions area lists all of the discussions in a particular course. To view course discussions, swipe to the left until you reach the Discussions screen. You can tap on a discussion to view, post, and reply to comments.

Create a Discussion

You can create a discussion by clicking on the Create (+) button on the upper right corner of the screen.

Course Grades

The Grades area displays the Midterm/Final grades and Grading Period grades by grading category. You can access the Grades section through the left hand side bar by swiping horizontally. Then choose the course you'd like to access the grades of.

Add or Edit Grades

You can view graded items by tapping on the title of the test/quiz, assignment, or discussion. To add or edit grades:

  1. Tap on the row of the graded item. A list of the course members will appear.
  2. Tap on a member’s name to add or edit the grade.
  3. You can use the sliding bar to enter a point value, or tap on the field to manually enter a grade through the keypad.
  4. You can add an optional comment by tapping on the Comment to the right of the point field.
  5. Select the checkbox to display the comment to the student, or uncheck the checkbox to keep the comment only visible to you.
  6. Tap the Ok button to confirm the information.
  7. Repeat these steps for each student in the course.
  8. And Save Changes to complete.

View Assignment Submissions

You can view assignment submissions by tapping on the title of an assignment. If a student has made a submission, a link will appear below the student’s name.

  1. Tap on the Submission link. A list of student submissions will appear below in chronological order. Submission date and time will also appear, as well as a Late/On Time indicator.
  2. Tap on a revision. The student submission will appear below.
  3. Tap on the student submission you would like to view. Tapping the submission will download the document onto your device.
  4. Once download is complete, you can view the file directly from your device.

Note: If you’d like to hide any dropdown information, you can tap on the header (e.g. Revision, or Submission).

Additional Note: Grades will not appear for grading periods that have not yet started. Graded items without a grading period will populate under the appropriate grading category under No Grading Period.

 

Groups

The Groups area lists all of the groups for which you are an administrator or a member. To access a group, tap on the name of your choice. The following information is available under a particular group:

  • Updates
  • Upcoming
  • Discussion

Group Updates

Group updates show the Recent Activity for a particular group. For more information about Updates, please see Recent Activity.

Group Upcoming

To view Upcoming events for a particular group, swipe to the right to access the group Upcoming area. For more information, please see Upcoming.

Discussions

The Discussions area lists all of the discussions in a particular group. To view group discussions, swipe to the left until you reach the Discussions screen. You can tap on a discussion to view, post, and reply to comments.

 

Messages

The Messages area lists all of received and sent mail in your Schoology account.

Received Messages

The Inbox displays the received messages by default. A shaded background indicates an unopened message. To view the message, simply touch the message you would like to open.

Sent Messages

To view sent messages, swipe to left from the Inbox screen, and touch the message you would like to open.

Compose and Reply to Messages

To compose a message, tap on the Create button on the upper right corner of the screen while in the Inbox screen.

  1. Begin typing a name in the To field. The field will auto-populate with users to whom you may send messages. To select a user, simply tap on their name from among the list.
  2. Enter the subject of the message.
  3. Enter the content of the message.
  4. Tap the Post (>) button on the upper right corner to complete.

To reply to a message, open the message and tap on the Create button on the upper right corner of the screen.

Note: Depending on the settings in place at your school, you may or may not be able to send messages to everyone in the school directory.

 

People

The People area allows you to view all of the members in your School Directory in alphabetical order by last name. To view a member profile, simply tap on the user’s name.

Note: Depending on the settings in place at your school, you may or may not have access to view the school directory.

 

Profile

The Profile area displays your current profile information. The following information is listed in a user profile:

  • Profile picture
  • Name
  • School name
  • Email or Username
  • Recent Activity

To view personal updates, simply scroll down the Recent Activity on your user profile. These updates behave in the same manner as Recent Activity and Course and Group Updates.

Note: Depending on the settings in place at your school, you may or may not have access to personal updates.

 

Grades

The Grades area lists all of the courses for which you are an administrator or a member. To access the grades for a course section, tap on the name of your choice. The following information is available under a particular course section:

  • Midterm/Final grades
  • Test/Quiz, Assignment, and Graded Discussion grades organized by grading period and grading category
  • Test/Quiz, Assignment, and Grade Discussion grades with no grading period

Add or Edit Grades

You can view graded items by tapping on the title of the test/quiz, assignment, or discussion. To add or edit grades:

  1. Tap on the row of the graded item. A list of the course members will appear.
  2. Tap on a member’s name to add or edit the grade.
  3. You can use the sliding bar to enter a point value, or tap on the field to manually enter a grade through the keypad.
  4. You can add an optional comment by tapping on the Comment to the right of the point field.
  5. Select the checkbox to display the comment to the student, or uncheck the checkbox to keep the comment only visible to you.
  6. Tap the Ok button to confirm the information.
  7. Repeat these steps for each student in the course.
  8. And Save Changes to complete.

View Assignment Submissions

You can view assignment submissions by tapping o the title of an assignment. If a student has made a submission, a link will appear below the student name.

  1. Tap on the submission link. A list of student submissions will appear below in chronological order. Submission date and time will also appear, as well as a Late/On Time indicator.
  2. Tap on a revision. The student submission will appear below.
  3. Tapping on the submission will download the file onto your device.
  4. Once download is complete, you can view the assignment submission directly from your device!

Note: Grades will not appear for grading periods that have not yet started. Graded items without a grading period will populate under the appropriate grading category under No Grading Period.

Additional Note: If you’d like to hide any dropdown information, you can tap on the header (e.g. Revision, or Submission).

 

Logout

The Logout button is located on the Home screen. You may logout at any time by tapping on the Home icon on the upper left corner of the screen. On the Home screen, the Logout icon is located on the upper right corner.

Note: You will stay logged-in until the application until you manually logout or uninstall the application.

Additional Note: If you’d like to hide any dropdown information, you can tap on the header (e.g. Revision, or Submission).

 

Logout

The Logout button is located on the Home screen. You may logout at any time by tapping on the Home icon on the upper left corner of the screen. On the Home screen, the Logout icon is located on the upper right corner.

Note: You will stay logged-in until the application until you manually logout or uninstall the application.

column2:
Student Mastery Reporting allows instructors to view student achievement on any standard or learning objective that has been aligned to Assignments, Test/Quiz Questions, or Discussions within a course. This area contains multiple views that allow instructors to evaluate how students are learning and pinpoint students that may need additional attention.

To get started, you will need:

  1. Standards aligned content
  2. A preferred mastery grading scale (Grade Setup > Add > Scale)

Using Student Mastery Reporting

To access this area, instructors can go to any Course and click on the Mastery left menu option. The Mastery reporting area will display the overall grades that each student has for any alignments on graded course materials.

Each grade is color coded based on achievement thresholds and a star icon indicates which students have mastered the standard/learning objective.

Student Mastery Reporting can be customized to accommodate most any standards-based grading model you choose. You can also view student achievement in a number of different ways. These "views" provide context and a more complete picture of student understanding.

Student Achievement Overview

The Student Achievement Overview shows you the achievement levels of your entire course at a glance. This is the pivot point for Mastery Reporting, enabling you to switch to the Learning Objectives view and quickly drill down to individual students and objectives. This view also shows: 

  1. Whether the student meets or exceeds your expectations or not via color coding
  2. The Mastery Progress for each objective
  3. The average student score
  4. The number of graded materials associated with each objective
  5. Whether or not the student has achieved the desired level of mastery

From this Student Achievement Overview, you can easily customize your mastery settings using the Gear Icon at the top. You can choose your grading scale and set achievement levels—i.e., the thresholds for missing, meeting, and exceeding expectations. You can even set how many times a student has to meet expectations to achieve mastery.

  • Set Achievement Levels
    This setting determines how student performance and mastery are evaluated
    • Meets Expectations - Sets the minimum score for the light green color
    • Exceeds Expectations - Sets the minimum score for the dark green color
    • Mastery - Sets the requirements for students to achieve mastery on a standard/learning objective
  • Grade Overall Learning Objectives
    This setting determines how the overall grades are calculated for each standard/learning objective
    • Average - Displays the average score from all grades for that particular alignment
    • Highest Score - Displays the highest of all grades for that particular alignment
  • Display Achievement Levels as
    This setting determines how the grades are displayed for each standard/learning objective by letting you select a grading scale

If you’re not sure what standards-based model best suits your courses, we recommend reading Formative Assessment & Standards-Based Grading by Robert J. Marzano. Student Mastery Reporting was designed to enable all the grading systems discussed in his book.

How Are Mastery Scores Calculated?

Scores for each standard/learning objective are calculated using only the grades that are given for that specific alignment. Since Assignments, Test/Quiz Questions, and Discussions can all be graded, Schoology will calculate mastery scores specific to each type of content to ensure accuracy.

Keep in mind that you choose one grading scale for Student Mastery Reporting, so each graded item, whether graded by a rubric, percentage, or point-based scale will be calculated to fit your chosen mastery scale.

Type of Course Material Using Alignment Rubric Without Rubric
Assignment Only the specific score given to the alignment is used in calculation The overall score given to the assignment
Tests/Quizzes

Only individual questions that are aligned to the standard/objective are used in calculation

For each individual question with a rubric, only the specific score given to the alignment is used

Only individual questions that are aligned to the standard/objective are used in calculation
Discussion Only the specific score given to the alignment is used in calculation The overall score given to the discussion

 

View Achievement by Learning Objective

By toggling to the Learning Objectives view at the top of your page, you can see the range of scores your students received for each graded material organized by learning objective.

The box-plot square represents the average score and the lines extend to the highest and lowest scores. Notice that you can also customize your Mastery Settings from this view.

 

View Achievement by Individual Student

You can view an individual student's mastery report by clicking on the student names within the main view of Mastery. This view will show you (and your student) a list of all standards/learning objectives with their overall scores for each.

Color-coded graphs enable you to see of all the items that are aligned to each objective and how the student scored for each item. The items in the graph are displayed in the order in which they appear in the course folder structure, letting you track student performance as they progress through the course.

Viewing Achievement by Individual Learning Objective

Lastly, you can view student achievement based on a single learning objective by clicking on the one you want at the top of the Achievement Overview page. This view provides the same at-a-glance qualities of the Overview, but helps you better understand how each student performed on each assessment.

column2:
The new School Analytics interface is now available (Enterprise feature)! This update to the feature will allow System Administrators to better assess the adoption and usage rate of Schoology at their school or organization.

At the top of the Analytics area, we display total number of school buildings, active users, active courses, and groups in your school.  Inactive users and inactive courses are not included in this count.

Analytics

The data can be broken down by Total Visits, Page Views, Average Time per Visit, Comments Posted, Submissions, and Files Uploaded.

  • Total Visits encompasses each user visit to Schoology.
  • Page Views displays each action into a page, or each access of a page. You’ll find an average page view per user displayed under the Page Views title.
  • Avg. Time Per Visit displays the length of time, on average, a user spends per visit. This number is displayed by hour:minute:seconds.
  • Comments Posted encompasses comments for nearly every area of Schoology, including:
  • Blogs
  • Dropbox
  • Assignments
  • Tests/Quizzes
  • Media Albums and album images
  • Comments made to update posts
  • Submissions encompasses all Assignment dropbox and Test/Quiz submissions, including revisions and multiple submissions.
  • Files Uploaded encompasses files uploaded to nearly every area of Schoology, including:
  • Dropbox
  • Files/Links Index
  • Attachments
  • Media embeds
  • Media Albums
  • Files/Links in Resources

View by User Type and Schools

You may filter the view by User Type to compare actions by  Faculty, Student, or Parent. Faculty users are users with a role marked Faculty.

You may also filter the view by Schools to compare schools in your district. If you don't see this option in your School Analytics, you may ignore this section, which pertains to schools with more than one building.

In each of these views, the default displays all User Types and all Schools. To view by a particular user type or school, you may click on the key at the bottom of the graph. You can also filter by school through the dropdown near the top. To clear all filters, simply click, Clear Selection.

Date Range

We provide default date ranges of data, but you can create a custom range from the dropdown near the top.
column4: Improved School Analytics

column2:
The Schoology Help Center is located in the downfacing arrow at the top right corner of your Schoology account. You can access the Help Center by clicking on the Help Center link.

The Help Center is divided into three main areas: Schoology Guides, Community, and Announcements.  You may use the Search bar to search across these areas.

 

Search

Schoology is a robust platform. You might be well-versed in some areas of Schoology, and have questions about areas you haven't yet encountered. We want to provide as much helpful information as possible, and thus, some forums may require a lot of reading and scrolling.  To better navigate the forums, we recommend the following tips:

  • Use either full questions or keywords when searching in the Search bar.
  • When using keywords, enter words you see on Schoology (e.g. Assignment, rather than Homework).
  • To search a string of words, place the words within quotation marks (e.g. "Add members," rather than Add members).
  • When inside a topic, consider using the Find feature to search for a keyword or phrase. On a PC, hold Ctrl and press the F key.  On a Mac, hold Command and press the F key.

 

Announcements

The Promoted Articles at the center of Help Center showcase the latest updates, features, and announcements in Schoology.

Announcements

The Announcements forum contains our most recent feature updates for the web platform.  These updates include changes to existing features, as well as highlights regarding new features.

Schoology Status Monitor

The Schoology Status Monitor forum provides information on performance-related issues.  If you're experiencing an issue related to performance (e.g. delayed loading times, Mad Scientist messages), please check this forum for more information.  The Status page, status.schoology.com, provides the most up-to-date information.  If Schoology is performing normally, but you're experiencing an issue, you may submit a ticket to reach our Support Team.  Schools with SSO should contact their System Administrator to submit a ticket on their behalf.

 

Schoology Guides

For instructions on Schoology's features, please visit the Help Guides. The documentation is divided into 4 default roles: System Admin (Enterprise), Teacher, Student and Parent. Please visit the forum most pertinent to you. 

System Admin

System Admin roles are responsible for managing Schoology for their entire school or organization. This role is available for Enterprise accounts to ensure adequate support and training during the early stages of implementation. This forum provides detailed instructions, tips, and processes specifically available to the System Admin role. For more information about teacher roles, please see the Instructors forum.

Instructors

Teacher roles are responsible for administering courses and students enrolled in their courses. This role is synonymous to the "Instructor" account you had selected during Sign Up. The Instructors forum provides detailed instructions, tips, and processes available for course and group administrators.

Students

Student roles are members of courses and groups in Schoology. Unless your school or organization is administered by a System Admin, students must use a Course or Group Access Code to register a new account. They may enroll in subsequent courses and groups from within their existing Schoology account. The Students forum provides detailed instructions on the features available to students. If you're a course or group administrator, you may be interested in this forum for more information about the ways in which students engage with your courses and groups.

Parents

Parent roles are associated with existing student accounts in Schoology. Unless your school is administered by a System Admin, parents must use a Parent Access code to register a new account. They may add subsequent children to their account from within their existing Schoology account. The Parents forum provides detailed instructions on the features available to parents.  If you're a System Admin or Instructor, you may be interested in using this forum to engage parents and provide guidance for their accounts.

You'll find other useful information in the Help Center as well:

Mobile Apps

The Mobile Apps forum is divided into Instructor Guides for the iOS and Android apps. Instructions for each area of the app are contained in a single forum, allowing you to scroll down and find the information you need without having to navigate away from the page.

System Requirements & Troubleshooting Tips

The System Requirements & Troubleshooting Tips forum contains information regarding helpful ways to solve issues you might encounter on the site. If you encounter difficulty on the site, we recommend that you visit this forum and search for possible solutions. If you're a System Administrator or Instructor, you might find this forum helpful in assisting users at your school or organization.

FAQs

The FAQs forum is a compilation of questions frequently asked by our community. Please feel free to browse this forum at your own pace, or use the search bar to look for specific answers.

Schoology Videos

The Schoology Videos forum allows you to view and search for helpful videos.

 

Ask Questions and Share Ideas

If you have an question you'd like to ask the Schoology Community, or if you have a great idea you'd like to share with others, visit the Ask Questions and Share Ideas area to interact with us and with each other.

Community Q&A

The Community Q&A forum allows you to ask fellow educators, instructors, and administrators about how they use Schoology, how to accomplish general tasks, or about their opinions on the best method of teaching and product usage.

Community Feature Requests - Schoology Web Platform

The Community Feature Requests forum for the Web Platform allows you to search for great ideas and to add your own suggestions about ways to improve your experience on Schoology! Be sure to "Follow" the topics you find interesting so that you receive a notice if there's a new feature that implements the idea.

Communtiy Feature Requests - iOS and Android App

The iOS and Android App Feature Requests forum allows you to search for and add ideas that improve your experience using the iOS and Android mobile apps. Be sure to "Follow" the topics you find interesting so that you receive a notice if there's a new release that implements the idea.

Community Feature Requests - Third Party Integration

The Third Party Feature Requests forum allows you to request systems you'd like to see integrated with Schoology! Please be sure to describe how you'd like to see the integration in Schoology, as well as the reason the integration would be helpful for you.

Completed Feature Requests

When a feature you've requested is implemented in Schoology, we'll provide an update for you and move the topic to the Completed Feature Requests area.

Additional Questions

If you have additional questions, you can submit a ticket to reach our Support Team.

 

Regards,

The Schoology Team
column4: How to use the Schoology Help Center

Hello everyone,

We love hearing your feedback, we value your ideas, and we appreciate your sharing of questions and answers with other Schoology users. Most importantly, we want to make sure you have a great place to foster this kind of community.

This fall, on Monday, September 9, we’re opening a dedicated area for the community in our Help Center, support.schoology.com. By October 15, 2013, our current Community Support Forum (community.schoology.com) will be closed. The reason we’re moving the community support to support.schoology.com is to create centralized experience for you, where you can learn about Schoology, share your ideas, and ask questions from a single place.

In addition, please know that we’ve strived to record and track every request we’ve heard from you on the Community Support Forum, so none of your great suggestions will be lost.

To learn more about these changes, please find our blog post for details on the Feature Requests and Community Q&A areas!

 

Sincerely,
column4: Important News: We're Expanding the Help Center by Adding Community Support
